org.cicirello.algengine

Interface RemoteParallelAlgorithms

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ParallelAlgorithmEngine

    public interface RemoteParallelAlgorithms
extends java.rmi.Remote
    Interface to distributed algorithms available via Java RMI.
    Version:
    8.15.2017
    Author:
    Vincent A. Cicirello

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double[][] multiply(int numThreads, double[][] a, double[][] bTranspose)
      Matrix multiplication.
      double pi(int n, int numThreads)
      A multithreaded Monte Carlo estimate of Pi.

    • Method Detail

      • multiply

        double[][] multiply(int numThreads,
                    double[][] a,
                    double[][] bTranspose)
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Matrix multiplication. Computes a*b. Assumes that the dimensions of a and b are such that a*b is a legal operation. Otherwise, may throw a bounds exception.
        Parameters:
        numThreads - The number of threads to use for the multiplication on the remote server.
        a - The first matrix,
        bTranspose - The transpose of the second matrix.
        Returns:
        a*b
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - When exceptional behavior occurs on the RMI server.

      • pi

        double pi(int n,
          int numThreads)
   throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        A multithreaded Monte Carlo estimate of Pi. Divides the number of samples, n, equally among the threads. If n is not divisible by the number of threads, uses the smallest n' > n such that n' is divisible by the number of threads.
        Parameters:
        n - The minimum number of samples.
        numThreads - The number of threads to use.
        Returns:
        Estimate of Pi.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - When exceptional behavior occurs on the RMI server.
